title: Stock Movers: BAE Systems, Tesco, Orsted
description: Bloomberg journalists discuss today's biggest winners and losers in the stock market. Listen for analysis on the companies making news on Wall Street.
content: On this episode of Stock Movers: - Defence stocks Rolls-Royce and BAE Systems are helping provide a sizeable boost to the FTSE 100 as trading gets underway.Norway has picked the UK as the supplier of frigates for its navy, in what would be the biggest ever investment in the Nordic country’s defense. It would also support 4,000 jobs in the UK, more than half of them at BAE Systems' Glasgow shipyards. - The growth outlook for Tesco remains intact, JPMorgan writes in note as it places the retailer on a positive catalyst watch ahead of first-half earnings on Oct. 2. - Orsted shares gain as much as 4.7% after Equinor decided to support the proposal to strengthen the offshore wind company’s balance sheet. Meanwhile, BofA cut its price target on Orsted to a new street low citing US uncertainty. Tiwa Adebayo
summary: The UK has chosen to provide its biggest ever investment in the country's defense by purchasing frigates from Norway. This investment would support 4,000 jobs in the UK, more than half of which would be at BAE Systems' Glasgow shipyards. Meanwhile, Orsted shares rose by up to 4.7% after Equinor supported the proposal to strengthen the company's balance sheet.
shortSummary: The stock market was volatile as investors digested the latest developments, with Rolls-Royce, BAE Systems, and Orsted gaining momentum amid US political uncertainty.
